column22: > 21 Dec; by Order of Gov of Jam, de jure rate fixed at Sp silver $ 1 = 0.5.0 Sterl
> 23 Feb; by Act; de jure rate Sp silver $ 1 = 0.5.0 Sterl
WI inc Jam put on gold std by Queen Anne on 18 Jun 1704
1707 < change from 5s to 6s 3p < 1722; so set at midpoint
> 11 Nov; by Act, legally set at Sp silver $ 1 = 6s 8d

column22: > 31 Dec, Act had effect of increasing FX “soon after”

column9: Accts only in Jamaica currency > 12 Jun; Chalmers 1893 p 140

column22: > 23 Mar; by Order of HM, introduced British silver to WI
1s Sterling = 1s 8d currency by convention made official by Act 15 Nov
Sp. silver dollar set at 0.4.2 on 7 Sep for all WI; Martin 1839 Appendix I p 25

column9: > 21 Jun; by Proclam of Super Int.; de facto $1 = 4s

column22: > 31 Dec; by Act, Jamaica currency = Sterling
Amt. of Sp. silver dollars greatly diminishes in Jam; Chalmers 1893 p 112

column9: Accts in Spanish silver dollars > 21 Feb
Panic of 1873; silver value plummets; US + Europe move to gold std

column22: Sp. silver dollar demonetised by Act; Chalmers 1893 p 113

column9: Guatemala silver $ made std > 15 Sep; C.5897-1; BB 1893 p X1
Possibly = market rather than Treasury rate
De facto rate $ 1 = 0.2.1 < Jul; 0.2.0 thereafter, per C.7944-14
US gold $ on 15 Oct; C.7944-14; Accts in US gold dollars, BB p X2; De facto Gua silver $ 1 = 0.2.0, per C.7944-14
UK abandons gold std. > 21 Sep; Hon stays with US gold $
UK decimalises Sterling > 14 Feb; US leaves gold std > 15 Aug
